intro: Bathysa panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian bathysa, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Bathysa panamensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
